alert.note: Alert for Christian; Todd; Trigg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 1:28AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Christian, southeastern Trigg and Todd Counties through 115 AM CST... At 1227 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking two strong thunderstorms one 9 miles southwest of Elkton and the other 6 miles east of Oak Grove in southern Todd and Christian Counties. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Guthrie around 1230 AM CST. Elkton around 1240 AM CST. Hopkinsville and Pembroke around 1245 AM CST. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 78 and 92. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
